pr_title: Fix doris thirdparty compile error for Ubuntu14.04

timeline.message: Fix doris be compile error for Ubuntu14.04

replies.bodyText:
make[2]: *** No rule to make target /home/work/project/doris/thirdparty/installed/bin/flatc', needed by src/arrow/ipc/File_generated.h'.  Stop.
make[1]: *** [src/arrow/ipc/CMakeFiles/metadata_fbs.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
just one solution of it, not so familiar with cmake, maybe there are some better solution work for ubuntu14.04 compile error fix
replies.author: caiconghui

replies.bodyText: The cmake is new enough, can you udpate doris to the current master version? I have already bumped up arrow to 0.15.1 version. You can try to see if the problem is there too.
replies.author: imay

replies.bodyText:
-- CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS:  -Wno-noexcept-type  -fdiagnostics-color=always -O3 -DNDEBUG  -Wall -msse4.2
CMake Error at src/arrow/ipc/CMakeLists.txt:63 (get_target_property):
get_target_property() called with non-existent target "flatbuffers::flatc".
CMake Error at src/arrow/ipc/CMakeLists.txt:65 (get_target_property):
get_target_property() called with non-existent target "flatbuffers::flatc".
replies.author: caiconghui

replies.bodyText: en, if ubuntu install flatbuffers already, it also may work, but it may need the true version, so use the compiled flatbuffers in doris thirdparty may ensure always true
replies.author: caiconghui
